alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Kearney (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 29 at 5:26PM CDT until April 29 at 6:00PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: The National Weather Service in Hastings has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Franklin County in south central Nebraska... Southern Kearney County in south central Nebraska... * Until 600 PM CDT. * At 526 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Axtell, or 17 miles east of Holdrege, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and hail up to two inches in diameter. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * Locations impacted include... Minden. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
